page.title: 02RECENT HISTORY continued...
page.content:
Less importance has been placed on Mylor as a farming area.The majority of people commute into the towns as Mylor boasts no major industrial jobs.
The playing fields were opened in 1947 as a lease-hold from Col.Trefusis on the condition that he could graze his cattle on the meadows.On May 13th 1963 a hall was built on the grounds for use as a Youth Club.The Brownies and Tregetreath Sailing Club were set up in 1954.
The Cornish Music Festival began here in 1953 by Rev.F.Martin and Mr.Sinfield of Perranarworthal where it was staged in Tremayne Hall.When it out-grew Mylor it moved to Truro to become the 3 Spires Festival.
